section.note:
The specified LDAP Bridge will be used to look for linked Matrix users based on the SAML user ID attribute. No user will be created when using this option. You do not need to set a create location.
You are required to be a System Administrator to configure this option. Please contact your System Administrator to set this up for you.

section.name: SAML 2.0 Service URLs
section.note:
If there are multiple URLs applied, the service URLs are selected closest to current URL. User must access the service URLs matching with the SP metadata registered with IDP.
For example, if HTTPS service URLs are registered with IDP, user must only access using HTTPS URLs.

These metadata schemas will be applied to created assets. Values for these schemas' fields may be supplied by the user when creating the asset. By default, the complete interface for these schemas, exactly as it would appear in the administration interface, will be printed above the default create form for each asset type. It is recommended that the create form be customised (see below) so that the individual fields can be laid out appropriately within the form using %metadata-F_(fieldid)% keywords.

section.name: Populate User Attributes
section.note: Populate user attributes with predefined values on creation/linking of user asset. Global keywords are supported. For example, to prefill with a SAML attribute "first_name", use keyword %globals_session_saml_attributes_first_name% in the value. If the SAML attribute is stored as array structure, you can use numeric index to access specific array element. e.g %globals_session_saml_attributes_first_name_0%. Keyword %globals_session_saml_attributes% will print all attributes in JSON format string.

section.name: Sync User Attributes
section.note: Similar to the Populate User Attributes function except that it happens every time the user logs into Matrix.

You may select a paint layout to apply to newly created assets. This paint layout is an asset based layout which means it will be applied to all URLs of the asset and will be inherited by all of its children.

You may select an override paint layout to apply to newly created assets. This paint layout is an asset based override layout which means it will be applied to all URLs of the asset but will not be inherited by any of its children.
